Operation 'DuplicatePreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is generic. Description is verbose and contains redundant information. Improved version clarifies that this creates a new design in the user's library, explicitly states the return value (newly created design object), and removes circular references. Better for AI agents to understand the operation creates a new resource with a unique ID.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs**.

Like duplicating one of your existing designs, you are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate design will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs. You can retrieve the IDs for Twilio SendGrid pre-built designs using the "List SendGrid Pre-built Designs" endpoint.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found above.
data.summary_suggestion: Duplicate a pre-built design with optional name
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of a pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library. The request body is optional; if no `name` is provided, the duplicate will be named "Duplicate: [original name]". You can customize the duplicate's name by passing a `name` value in the request. The duplicated design receives a unique ID and is added to your Design Library. Returns the newly created design object with its assigned ID and metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description is verbose and contains redundant information. Improved version clarifies that this creates a new design in the user's library, explicitly states the return value (newly created design object), and removes circular references. Better for AI agents to understand the operation creates a new resource with a unique ID.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single pre-built design**.

A GET request to `/designs/pre-builts/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific pre-built design.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving details about a pre-built design that you wish to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a pre-built design by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific pre-built design from the Twilio SendGrid library. Requires the pre-built design ID as a path parameter. Returns the complete design object including its structure, metadata, and content. This operation is typically used before duplicating a design to review its layout and content, or to examine available pre-built templates.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about the ID parameter. Description is repetitive and doesn't clearly state what data is returned. Improved version specifies the required parameter, clarifies the return value structure, and provides context about typical use cases for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'CreateDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create Design' is too generic. Description is verbose with external links but lacks clarity on inputs (DesignInput schema), outputs (DesignOutput schema), and specific return values. Added schema references, return object details, and use cases for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new design**.

You can add a new design by passing data, including a string of HTML email content, to `/designs`. When creating designs from scratch, be aware of the styling constraints inherent to many email clients. For a list of best practices, see our guide to [Cross-Platform Email Design](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/cross-platform-html-design/).

The Design Library can also convert your design's HTML elements into drag and drop modules that are editable in the Designs Library user interface. For more, visit the [Design and Code Editor documentation](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/editor/#drag--drop-markup).

Because the `/designs` endpoint makes it easy to add designs, you can create a design with your preferred tooling or migrate designs you already own without relying on the Design Library UI.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new email design with HTML content
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new design in your Design Library by submitting HTML email content and metadata. Accepts a DesignInput object containing the design name, HTML content, and optional editor type. Returns a DesignOutput object with the newly created design's ID, name, HTML content, and metadata. The created design can be used in Single Sends and Automations. Note: Email designs should follow cross-platform HTML design best practices to ensure compatibility across email clients.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create Design' is too generic. Description is verbose with external links but lacks clarity on inputs (DesignInput schema), outputs (DesignOutput schema), and specific return values. Added schema references, return object details, and use cases for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'ListDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'List Designs' is too vague and doesn't indicate pagination capability. Description lacks information about return schema (DesignOutputSummary) and what fields are included. Added schema reference, pagination details, and clarification about user-created vs pre-built designs for better AI agent routing.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of designs already stored in your Design Library**.

A GET request to `/designs` will return a list of your existing designs. This endpoint will not return the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. Pre-built designs can be retrieved using the `/designs/pre-builts` endpoint, which is detailed below.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve list of user-created designs with pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of designs stored in your Design Library. Returns an array of DesignOutputSummary objects containing design metadata (ID, name, created/updated timestamps, editor type). Supports pagination via the `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). This endpoint returns only user-created designs; use the `/designs/pre-builts` endpoint to retrieve Twilio SendGrid's pre-built designs.
data.reasoning: Summary 'List Designs' is too vague and doesn't indicate pagination capability. Description lacks information about return schema (DesignOutputSummary) and what fields are included. Added schema reference, pagination details, and clarification about user-created vs pre-built designs for better AI agent routing.

message: Operation 'DuplicateDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary 'Duplicate Design' lacks context about the optional naming feature. Description is unclear about required vs optional inputs and doesn't reference the DesignDuplicateInput schema or return DesignOutput schema. Added schema references, clarified optional parameters, and explained the automatic naming behavior for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to duplicate one of your existing designs**.

Modifying an existing design is often the easiest way to create something new.

You are not required to pass any data in the body of a request to this endpoint. If you choose to leave the `name` field blank, your duplicate will be assigned the name of the design it was copied from with the text "Duplicate: " prepended to it. This name change is only a convenience, as the duplicate will be assigned a unique ID that differentiates it from your other designs.

You can modify your duplicate's name at the time of creation by passing an updated value to the `name` field when making the initial request.
More on retrieving design IDs can be found below.
data.summary_suggestion: Duplicate an existing design with optional name
data.description_suggestion: Creates a copy of an existing design by its ID. Accepts an optional DesignDuplicateInput object with a custom name for the duplicate. If no name is provided, the duplicate is automatically named "Duplicate: [original design name]". Returns a DesignOutput object with the new design's unique ID, name, HTML content, and metadata. The duplicate is independent and can be modified without affecting the original design.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Duplicate Design' lacks context about the optional naming feature. Description is unclear about required vs optional inputs and doesn't reference the DesignDuplicateInput schema or return DesignOutput schema. Added schema references, clarified optional parameters, and explained the automatic naming behavior for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single design**.

A GET request to `/designs/{id}` will retrieve details about a specific design in your Design Library.

This endpoint is valuable when retrieving information stored in a field that you wish to update using a PATCH request.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific design by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single design from your Design Library by its ID. Returns a DesignOutput object containing the design's complete metadata including name, HTML content, editor type, and timestamps. Useful for retrieving current design state before making updates via PATCH requests or for accessing design content for use in Single Sends and Automations.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get Design' is too generic. Description lacks information about return schema (DesignOutput) and what fields are included. Added schema reference, specific return fields, and use cases for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'UpdateDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Update Design' doesn't convey the partial update capability. Description lacks information about return schema (DesignOutput) and which fields are updatable. Added 'partial update' context, schema reference, and clarified that only provided fields are modified for better AI agent routing.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to edit a design**.

The Design API supports PATCH requests, which allow you to make partial updates to a single design. Passing data to a specific field will update only the data stored in that field; all other fields will be unaltered.

For example, updating a design's name requires that you make a PATCH request to this endpoint with data specified for the `name` field only.

```
{
    "name": "<Updated Name>"
}
```
data.summary_suggestion: Partially update design fields by ID
data.description_suggestion: Updates one or more fields of an existing design using a PATCH request. Supports partial updates - only provided fields are modified; all other fields remain unchanged. Accepts an inline request body with updatable fields (e.g., name, HTML content, editor type). Returns the updated DesignOutput object reflecting all changes. Example: to update only the design name, pass {"name": "New Name"}.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Update Design' doesn't convey the partial update capability. Description lacks information about return schema (DesignOutput) and which fields are updatable. Added 'partial update' context, schema reference, and clarified that only provided fields are modified for better AI agent routing.

message: Operation 'DeleteDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Summary 'Delete Design' doesn't emphasize the permanent nature. Description warns about permanence but lacks information about side effects (design becomes unavailable for use) and response status. Added emphasis on irreversibility, side effects, and HTTP response code for AI agent safety and clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a single design**.

Be sure to check the ID of the design you intend to delete before making this request; deleting a design is a permanent action.
data.summary_suggestion: Permanently delete a design by ID
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a design from your Design Library by its ID. This action is irreversible and cannot be undone. The design will no longer be available for use in Single Sends, Automations, or for duplication. Verify the design ID before executing this operation. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Delete Design' doesn't emphasize the permanent nature. Description warns about permanence but lacks information about side effects (design becomes unavailable for use) and response status. Added emphasis on irreversibility, side effects, and HTTP response code for AI agent safety and clarity.

message: Operation 'ListPreBuiltDesign' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'List SendGrid Pre-built Designs' is verbose and doesn't indicate pagination. Description lacks return schema information (DesignOutputSummary) and specific fields returned. Added schema reference, pagination details, and clarified the distinction from user-created designs endpoint for better AI agent routing and understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of pre-built designs provided by Twilio SendGrid**.

Unlike the `/designs` endpoint where *your* designs are stored, a GET request made to `designs/pre-builts` will retrieve a list of the pre-built Twilio SendGrid designs. This endpoint will not return the designs stored in your Design Library.

By default, you will receive 100 results per request; however, you can modify the number of results returned by passing an integer to the `page_size` query parameter.

This endpoint is useful for retrieving the IDs of Twilio SendGrid designs that you want to duplicate and modify.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated list of Twilio SendGrid pre-built designs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of pre-built email designs provided by Twilio SendGrid. Returns an array of DesignOutputSummary objects containing pre-built design metadata (ID, name, editor type, timestamps). Supports pagination via the `page_size` query parameter (default: 100 results per request). This endpoint returns only Twilio SendGrid's pre-built designs; use the `/designs` endpoint to retrieve your user-created designs. Pre-built designs can be duplicated and customized for your campaigns.
data.reasoning: Summary 'List SendGrid Pre-built Designs' is verbose and doesn't indicate pagination. Description lacks return schema information (DesignOutputSummary) and specific fields returned. Added schema reference, pagination details, and clarified the distinction from user-created designs endpoint for better AI agent routing and understanding.
